prompt: This was the second entry in the regular Columbo series, and it holds up well today
answers:
This was the second entry in the regular Columbo series, and it holds up well today (although it's very much better than it first came out). The plot consists of a group of two thieves that rob a bank and they are joined by the evil thief (I'll say this because we don't see him coming again). But, in doing so, they fail in some big way, as one man who has a hidden stash of money starts stealing. His nemesis who wants the money gets robbed of it. The other thief goes after the person who is robbing, with the help of one of his own guys. But the problem isn't the robber, but the thief. When this guy goes to help, it looks very dangerous. It's easy to forget that when he gets caught, the guy's been killed for his betrayal.

The plot is pretty solid as well, especially the ending, where the crooks decide not to keep stealing, because once again, some really evil people are getting their hands on their money. However, how they got money in this story was never clear to me, until the end credits. I didn't think much about that film and then decided this was a good movie anyway. Not much else to say about this film, except that it does have some great acting.

prompt: The Running Man is one of those films that if overwatched, would become boring and depressing even
answers: The Running Man is one of those films that if overwatched, would become boring and depressing even for those who liked the previous films. The story is about two teenage boys (Shakespeare, Hamlet and John Wayne) falling in love while running around from a mad guy. Once they realize they were actually attracted to each other, they want to spend the rest of their life together in peace and bliss. There are also some very moving scenes in the movie and the ending is hilarious. This film is a great family movie. I recommend this film to anyone with a family and a little budget of about $250+.
